citeinfo.title: Mineral Commodity Summaries 2022 - VANADIUM Data Release

descript.abstract: This data release contains the U.S. salient statistics and world production data extracted from the VANADIUM data sheet of the USGS Mineral Commodity Summaries 2022.
descript.purpose: Published on an annual basis, the USGS Mineral Commodity Summaries report is the earliest Government publication to furnish estimates covering nonfuel mineral industry data. Data sheets contain information on the domestic industry structure, Government programs, tariffs, and 5-year salient statistics for over 90 individual minerals and materials.
descript.supplinf: Where possible, data are those finalized for publication in the 2020 U.S. Geological Survey Minerals Yearbook Volume I - Metals and Minerals. For 2021, USGS National Minerals Information Center provided estimates based on available data from USGS surveys of the industry, other industry sources, and mineral commodity specialist research.

idinfo.accconst: None. Please see 'Distribution Info' for details.
idinfo.useconst: None. Users are advised to read the dataset's metadata thoroughly to understand appropriate use and data limitations.

citeinfo.title: USGS National Minerals Information Center Vanadium Web Page
citeinfo.othercit: Provides information and links to all available USGS National Minerals Information Center publications about VANADIUM by publication type and year.

attracc.attraccr: Where possible, data for all years except 2021 have been finalized for publication in the U.S. Geological Survey Minerals Yearbook Volume I - Metals and Minerals; otherwise the data are noted as estimated.

dataqual.logic: Data were checked to ensure that they match those published in the Mineral Commodity Summaries 2022. Data were peer reviewed by Mineral Commodity Specialists and approved by supervisors in compliance with USGS fundamental science practices.
dataqual.complete: This data release contains tabular data found in the associated publication Mineral Commodity Summaries 2022 (MCS 2022); additional detailed information is available in the full text version of MCS 2022.

citeinfo.title: USGS Minerals Yearbook Volume I - Metals and Minerals

srcinfo.srccontr: Source of salient statistics for 2017 through 2020 and basis for estimates for 2021. The data in the Minerals Yearbook are based on USGS surveys sent to companies involved in the industry for each mineral commodity.
trade statistics for 2017 through 2020 and basis of trade statistics estimates for 2021

procstep.procdesc: Salient statistics for each mineral commodity were compiled from published 2020 U.S. Geological Survey Minerals Yearbook Volume I - Metals and Minerals chapters or from finalized tables of those to be published. Data for 2021 were estimated based on available 2021 data and industry trends. Estimates for world production were made for 2021 in collaboration with USGS National Minerals Information Center Global Minerals Analysis specialists using best available data.

enttyp.enttypd: Comma Separated Value (CSV) file containing data.

attr.attrdef: Publication containing the data.
Mineral commodity for which the data were compiled.

edom.edomvd: Vanadium, when present in small amounts in certain ferrous alloys, can significantly improve their properties. Manufacturers of automobiles and machinery recognized the toughness and fatigue resistance of vanadium alloys as far back as the early 1900's, incorporating the alloys in axles, crankshafts, gears, and other critical components. Vanadium has been used together with aluminum to give the required strength in titanium alloys used in jet engines and high-speed airframes.

attr.attrdef: Year for which the data were compiled.
U.S. production: Mine, mill. Data are estimated for the most recent year.
Imports for consumption: Aluminum-vanadium master alloy. Data are estimated for the most recent year.
Imports for consumption: Ash and residues. Data are estimated for the most recent year.
Imports for consumption: Ferrovanadium. Data are estimated for the most recent year.
Imports for consumption: Oxides and hydroxides, other. Data are estimated for the most recent year.
Imports for consumption: Vanadium chemicals. Includes vanadium chlorides, hydrides, nitrides, and sulfates, as well as vanadates of vanadium. Data are estimated for the most recent year.
Imports for consumption: Vanadium metal. Includes waste and scrap. Data are estimated for the most recent year.
Imports for consumption: Vanadium ores and concentrates. Data are estimated for the most recent year.
Imports for consumption: Vanadium pentoxide. Data are estimated for the most recent year.
Exports: Aluminum-vanadium master alloy. Data are estimated for the most recent year.
Exports: Ash and residues. Data are estimated for the most recent year.
Exports: Ferrovanadium. Data are estimated for the most recent year.
Exports: Oxides and hydroxides, other. Data are estimated for the most recent year.
Exports: Vanadium metal. Includes waste and scrap. Data are estimated for the most recent year.
Exports: Vanadium ores and concentrates. Data are estimated for the most recent year.
Exports: Vanadium pentoxide. Data are estimated for the most recent year.
Consumption: Apparent. Defined as production + imports – exports + adjustments for industry stock changes. Data are estimated for the most recent year.
Consumption: Reported. Data are estimated for the most recent year.

Price: Average, vanadium pentoxide, dollars per pound. The 2017 annual average vanadium pentoxide price includes U.S. monthly averages for January to June 2017 and China monthly average prices for July to December 2017. The prices for 2018–2021 are the China annual average vanadium pentoxide prices. Source: CRU Group. Data are estimated for the most recent year.

Stocks: Yearend. Includes chlorides, ferrovanadium, vanadates, vanadium-aluminum alloy, other vanadium alloys, vanadium metal, vanadium pentoxide, and other specialty chemicals. Data are estimated for the most recent year.
Net import reliance as a percentage of apparent consumption. Net imports are defined as imports – exports + adjustments for industry stock changes. Data are estimated for the most recent year.

enttyp.enttypd: Comma Separated Value (CSV) file containing data.

attr.attrdef: Publication containing the data.
Country in which the mineral commodity is produced.

codesetd.codesets: Geopolitical Entities, Names, and Codes (GENC) Standard

attr.attrdef: Description of the form of commodity for which the production is measured, usually mine production (content of the mineral commodity in the ore) or refinery production of the mineral commodity.
Production in 2020.
Estimated production in 2021.

overview.eaover: Two CSV files were produced from the data published in the Mineral Commodity Summaries 2022. One includes U.S. Salient Statistics for production, consumption, trade, and other data pertinent to VANADIUM for the years 2017 to 2021. The other includes world VANADIUM production totals for countries that had production in 2020 and (or) 2021.
overview.eadetcit: Companion data for VANADIUM data sheet of Mineral Commodity Summaries 2022

cntaddr.address: Denver Federal Center, Building 810, Mail Stop 302

distinfo.distliab: Unless otherwise stated, all data, metadata and related materials are considered to satisfy the quality standards relative to the purpose for which the data were collected. Although these data and associated metadata have been reviewed for accuracy and completeness and approved for release by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the display or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty.
